To Check or Update Sign-In Info in Thunderbird

  • Open Thunderbird
  • Click Thunderbird -> Account Settings
  • (alternatively, In the left-hand pane, right-click your email account and select Account Settings)
  • Go to Server Settings on the left

There you'll see:

  • Server name (this is usually something like. pop.mail.yahoo.com)
  • Username — this should be your FULL email address
  • Authentication method — should be set to OAuth2 (if available) or Normal Password if using an app password

Hey @bryanttheinformer, sounds like you're close, but Thunderbird is having trouble authenticating your Verizon.net email on your new Windows 11 setup. This is common because Verizon email is now handled through AOL/Yahoo, and they require either OAuth2 or an app password.

Let's try this:

  • Open Thunderbird
  • Go to Menu > Account Settings
  • Under your Verizon account, go to Server Settings
  • Set Authentication Method to OAuth2
  • Scroll down to Outgoing Server (SMTP), select the Verizon SMTP server, click Edit
  • Set Authentication Method there to OAuth2 as well
  • Restart Thunderbird
  • You should get a Yahoo/AOL login window
  • Sign in with your full Verizon email address and approve Thunderbird access

If that works, you're done.
creator: Thundamike

You can't use OAuth2 with verizon.net servers. Use these settings:

imap.aol.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, yourname@verizon.net

smtp.aol.com, 465, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, yourname@verizon.net

It sounds to me like Thunderbird can't write to the profile folder correctly right now. This behavior is not expected. This [trouble writing to the folder] can happen if:

1. You're running Thunderbird from a USB drive or restricted location

2. The profile folder is read-only or permission-locked

3. Security software is interfering with Thunderbird's ability to save files

Are any of these occurring in your environment?
